sub_title: Material Scientist | Polymer Characterization | Application Scientist | Sustainable urban-rural development | Data Analyst | Impact driven | Hiking and Travel enthusiast
summary:
With 7 years of experience as a Materials Scientist, I have gained skills in designing, validating, executing, and troubleshooting experimental protocols for polymeric materials and most recently construction materials. I thrive on collaborating on developing new methods to answer project-specific questions, allowing me to use my interdisciplinary research skills. I am currently working on the development, optimization, and use of combined rheology and spectroscopic techniques to study the structure-property relationship of complex materials. 

✓CORE COMPETENCIES:
Data Analysis | Data Management | Data Visualization (Chemometrics) | Technical Writing | Scientific Writing | Communication skills | Research | Peer-reviewing | Cross-functional | Ability to work Autonomously and Collaboratively | Project management | Writing SOPs | Creative problem solving | Leadership skills

✓TECHNICAL SKILLS:
Rheology | Thermal-Field Flow Fractionation |High-throughput SEC | DLS | DRI | UV | MALLS | FTIR | NMR | BDS | PS and PMMA | Chitosan | Hydrogels | Cement | Polycarboxylic acids | Epoxy resins| Polyolefins 

✓SOFTWARE LITERACY:
LaTex | Microsoft Office Suite | Origin Pro| Matlab| Wix| WordPress

I am looking forward to contributing fruitfully whilst growing my scientific and professional skillset in your industrial organization. 

I would like to thank you for visiting my profile, and look forward to making your acquaintance and making a positive contribution to your project or business!

education.field_of_study: Natural Science (focus on Analytical and Physical Chemistry)
Blended cement characterization and microstructure analysis

awards.title: Outstanding Paper 2020 Award
awards.description: The publication titled: 'Interlaboratory study on rheological properties of cement pastes and reference substances: comparability of measurements performed with different rheometers and measurement geometries' in Mater Struct (2020) 53:90 was considered one of the best papers published  in 2020.

awards.title: 69th Lindau Nobel Laureate Meeting
awards.description: 40 Nobel Laureates meet +-600 young scientists from all over the world. These young scientists are selected through a two-stage application process and once they succeed they are invited to be an attendee and/a masterclass presenter. This year’s theme is physics.

awards.title: Karlsruhe House of Young Scientists Aspirant Grant
awards.description: The grant is awarded to an M.Sc student who is nearing the end of their masters and has shown interest in pursuing a doctorate at the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT). It  enables the potential supervisors to meet such aspirants in person and invite them to come to KIT for a period of one month.

awards.title: Borealis Poster Award (1st Place)
awards.description: The International Symposium on Polymer Analysis and Characterization (ISPAC) is a non-profit scientific organization whose purpose is to provide an international forum for the presentation of recent advances in the field of polymer analysis and characterization methodologies. The Borealis Poster Award is awarded a graduate student or post doctoral student who has the most innovative and outstanding poster at the conference. The Governing Board of ISPAC decides on the winner.
awards.issuer: 30th International Symposium on Polymer Analysis and Characterization, Linz, Austria

awards.title: IUPAC/UNESCO Poster Prize Winner
awards.description: It is a unique opportunity for (mainly) Southern African researchers and students to engage with world leaders in the field on their research in polymer science. Over the years the conferences had specific themes ranging from polyolefins over composites to materials with biological and medical applications. In 2017, the focus of the conference will be on advances in polymer synthesis and characterization, specifically in the field of bioactive materials. The poster prize is presented to the top three poster presenters as decided by a panel of established researchers.

awards.title: Rectors Award for Leadership
awards.description: This is highly prestigious award presented by the Rector. Awarded to a select few Stellenbosch University students who display excellence in leadership.
awards.issuer: Rector of Stellenbosch University-Wim De Villiers

awards.title: South African Chemical Institute (SACI) Young Chemists Symposium presenter

profile_positions.description: The FALCONESS-project is about scientific questions related to sustainable urban development in Africa. The link between engineering and scientific topics with socio-economic aspects is a core element. Subjects of study are Lagos, Dar es Salaam, Cairo, Johannesburg and Accra. The Bundesanstalt für Materialforschung und -prüfung and the University of Lagos in Nigeria take over the project coordination. Further partner institutes are University of Ghana, Ain Shams University, Egypt, University of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, University of the Witwatersrand, South Africa, and Technical University Munich, Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Hochschule Düsseldorf, and University of Bayreuth, all from Germany.
profile_positions.title: Subject Matter Expert

profile_positions.description: Development of in-situ rheological and spectroscopic (IR and NMR) techniques to characterize complex materials including polymers and cementitious materials. Correlation of the macroscopic mechanical properties (i.e gelation, curing, or structural build-up) to the microscopic chemical properties (i.e polymerization or hydrate formation). In this work, I managed a research grant worth €200 000 (excluding compensation) over 3 years, which has been renewed for a further 3 years due to successful project deliverables such as 3 peer reviewed articles and collaborations with other insitutions.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Researcher (Method Development and Materials Characterization)

company.name: ISEE (Innovation, Science, Engineering and Education) Africa conference

profile_positions.company: ISEE (Innovation, Science, Engineering and Education) Africa conference
profile_positions.description: Coordination and collaboration with more than 100 research and industry professionals to discuss criteria that influence global and African education within civil engineering (i.e engineers, town planners, material scientists, architects, the community at large). The built environment, e.g, roads, schools, bridges, etc, has many stakeholders. Oftentimes, engineers and architects are at the forefront of decisions made about the choice of material used in a building or the location but the skills of a material chemist are vital in material choice, specifically because sustainable alternatives to building materials are core. This workshop brought forth some specific edcuation criteria such as the use of supplementary cementitious materials, natural superplasticizers, and use of local aggregates as an alternative. The work is being continued in several other projects, on of which is Falconess. (find more information here: http://falconess.org/)
profile_positions.title: Workshop Coordinator and Facilitator

profile_positions.description:
Management of a 2-year research project, funded by the National Research Foundation, South Africa. 
▪	developed and used a combined a channel and column-based fractionation-Thermal-Field Flow Fractionation (ThFFF)/LC- coupled to Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy to separate and chemically characterize of complex polymers in solution 
▪	used different online and offline detectors (i.e DLS) to characterize and determine molar masses/distribution, hydrodynamic diameter (using Stokes-Einstein equation), and diffusion coefficients of complex materials such as copolymers.

The project resulted in all objectives being met within the set timeline and a joint publication with colleagues from Germany.
profile_positions.title: Project Management and Method Development experience gained as graduate researcher

volunteer_experiences.description: Spearhead initiatives that help young researchers in Sub-Saharan Africa connect with other researchers around the world both academically and interpersonally. Expose young researchers to research methodologies pertaining to sustainable construction and urbanization.
Outside of my core research, I am also passionate about sustainable/conscious urbanization and I am currently working on a cool project with professionals called FALCONESS (http://falconess.org/)
